events.body:
ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/a7f5d188cc7a23b1946d48693ada22fe90d9ffe0

Nit: Documentation in [`doc/tor.md`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/9774a958b501a6d439a734e18b29e04f59f973f6/doc/tor.md?plain=1#L196) should also be updated:

```diff
 (obviously, replace the .onion address with your own). It should be noted that you still
 listen on all devices and another node could establish a clearnet connection, when knowing
 your address. To mitigate this, additionally bind the address of your Tor proxy:

-    ./bitcoind ... -bind=127.0.0.1
+    ./bitcoind ... -bind=127.0.0.1:8334=onion
```

verification.payload:
tree 6273f2d39c448832b43bd228e27643a94ff303b8
parent a7f5d188cc7a23b1946d48693ada22fe90d9ffe0
author David Gumberg <davidzgumberg@gmail.com> 1722584716 +0200
committer Vasil Dimov <vd@FreeBSD.org> 1722584716 +0200

doc: tor.md: use -bind=127.0.0.1:8334=onion for the Tor bind

After https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22729 if
`-bind=127.0.0.1` is used, then bitcoind will not automatically
also bind on `127.0.0.1:8334`.

events.message:
doc: tor.md: use -bind=127.0.0.1:8334=onion for the Tor bind

After https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22729 if
`-bind=127.0.0.1` is used, then bitcoind will not automatically
also bind on `127.0.0.1:8334`.

events.body: `a7f5d188cc..6d33e13bd4`: append one commit with that update to `doc/tor.md`, thanks!

ACK 6d33e13bd493ca6cee7b52b990e4822a28e35d0a

Release notes look good to me now, thanks!

comments.body: Applied the `s/For example/Previously/` change. Initially I wrote "for example `1.2.3.4:8333`" but changed it to "for example `addr:port`", now this covers all is not an example anymore.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+Notable changes
+===============
+
+P2P and network changes
+-----------------------
+
+- Previously, if Bitcoin Core were listening for P2P connections, then
+  it would always bind on `127.0.0.1:8334` to listen for incoming Tor
+  connections. It was not possible to switch this off even if the node didn't
+  use Tor. Previously, a configuration `bind=addr:port` would result in
+  binding on `addr:port` and on `127.0.0.1:8334`. This has been changed and now
+  `bind=addr:port` results in binding on `addr:port` only. The default behavior
+  of binding to `0.0.0.0:8333` and `127.0.0.1:8334` has not been changed.
+
+  If you are using `bind=...` without `bind=...=onion` and rely on the previous
+  behavior to accept incoming Tor connections at `127.0.0.1:8334`, you need to
+  make this explicit by using `bind=... bind=127.0.0.1:8334=onion`. (#22729)
comments.body:
There's some duplication in the first three sentences (repeating that we bind to 127.0.0.1:8334) that can perhaps be removed.

Additionally, not mentioned is the new startup behaviour where we abort on failure to bind to any P2P port.

Suggestion:

```suggestion
- Previously if Bitcoin Core was listening for P2P connections, either using
  default settings or via `bind=addr:port` it would always also bind to
  `127.0.0.1:8334` to listen for Tor connections. It was not possible to switch
  this off, even if the node didn't use Tor. This has been changed and now
  `bind=addr:port` results in binding on `addr:port` only. The default behavior
  of binding to `0.0.0.0:8333` and `127.0.0.1:8334` has not been changed.

  If you are using a `bind=...` configuration without `bind=...=onion` and rely
  on the previous implied behavior to accept incoming Tor connections at
  `127.0.0.1:8334`, you need to now make this explicit by using `bind=host:port
  bind=127.0.0.1:8334=onion`. (#22729)
  
- Bitcoin Core will now fail to start up if any of its P2P binds fail, rather
  than the previous behaviour where we would only abort startup if all P2P
  binds had failed.
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+Notable changes
+===============
+
+P2P and network changes
+-----------------------
+
+- Previously, if Bitcoin Core were listening for P2P connections, then
+  it would always bind on `127.0.0.1:8334` to listen for incoming Tor
+  connections. It was not possible to switch this off even if the node didn't
+  use Tor. Previously, a configuration `bind=addr:port` would result in
+  binding on `addr:port` and on `127.0.0.1:8334`. This has been changed and now
+  `bind=addr:port` results in binding on `addr:port` only. The default behavior
+  of binding to `0.0.0.0:8333` and `127.0.0.1:8334` has not been changed.
+
+  If you are using `bind=...` without `bind=...=onion` and rely on the previous
+  behavior to accept incoming Tor connections at `127.0.0.1:8334`, you need to
+  make this explicit by using `bind=... bind=127.0.0.1:8334=onion`. (#22729)
comments.body: Done with some minor changes. Thanks!
